explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_liquids.rationale: Flash point: none (Lange, 14th, 1992), non-combustible (Solvent Pocket Book, 1994), or flame-retardant (Hommel, 1991, Card No.199)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: They are nonflammables or flame retardants. (a pocket book books (1994), Hommmel (1991) Card No.199)

self_heating_substances.rationale: They are nonflammables and flame retardants. (solvent pocket book (1994), Hommmel (1991) Card No.199)

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine and fluorine (but not oxygen) and these elements are chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on rat LD50 value: 43g/kg (ACGIH, 7th (2001), Japan Society for Occupational Health advice (1993), DFGOT vol.3 (1999), CERI Hazard Data, (1999), RTECS (2005), IUCID (2000)), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the data that lethal dose of rabbits is 11000mg/kg or exceeds it (ACGIH (2991), CERI Hazard Data (1999), and RTECS (2005), it was set as the outside of Category.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on calculated value = 397.68mg/L, it was judged as LC50 value with exposure to vapor with almost no mist. Standard values for ppm concentrations was applied, and it was classified as out of Category. 397.68mg/L is statistically calculated value from 3 rat LC50 values (4 hour exposure): 52000ppm (Industrial Hygiene Society (1993) and CERI Hazard Data (1999)), 52500ppm (EHC 113 (1990)), 68000ppm (Industrial Hygiene Society (1993) and CERI Hazard Data (1999)) (since the statistically calculated value was lower than the lowest value of the data, adopted the lowest data of 52000ppm)

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on description that mild irritation was admitted in the skin irritation study by the Draize method (24-hour exposure) in a rabbit (CERI Hazard Data, 1999), it was set to Category 3.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since in the test using a rabbit, irritation was not reached the acceptance criteria (DFGOT vol.3, 1999), and was not seen (CERI Hazard Data in 1999), it was set as the outside of Category.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory organ: No data. Skin: Although it showed negative for the Maximization method in the guinea pigs (CERI Hazard Data, 1999), we presupposed that it could not be classified for the insufficiency of data, since there was no description which otherwise negates skin sensitization clearly.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: There are descriptions of negative result with dominant lethal test on mice, which is an in vivo generation mutagenicity test using germ cells, (EHC 113 (1990), ACGIH (7th, 2001), DFGOT vol.3 (1999), and CERI Hazard Data (1999)), and there is no report of in vivo examination. So it was classified as out of Category.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since it was classified into A4 in ACGIH (ACGIH 7th, 2001), it was considered as the outside of Category.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: It was considered as out of Category based on the description that it is not observed effects on embryotoxicity/fetotoxicity and teratogenecity in rat organogenetic period inhalation exposure test at dose causing general toxicity to maternal animal (EHC 113 (1990)), ACGIH (7th, 2001), in the description with CERI Hazard Data (1999)), and the description of no abnormality in standard reproductive items in the rat inhalation exposure one-generation reproductive test ) (EHC 113 (1990), ACGIH (7th, 2001), CERI Hazard Data (1999))).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (respiratory tract irritation, narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In volunteers or accidents by evidence of exposure on humans, description that the symptoms accompanied to the transient reduction of psychomotricite, drowsiness, dizziness, memory impairments, symptoms accompanied to theanesthesia action etc., respiratory irritation was acknowledged (EHC 113 (1990), DFGOT vol.3 (1999)), and from the description that respiratory irritant and anesthetic actions were acknowledged inhalation exposure in a rat, a guinea pigs, and a dog (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), DFGOT vol.3 (1999) and CERI Hazard Data (1999)). So it was set as Category 3 (respiratory irritation, anesthesia action) .

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (central nervous system, liver) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the description that in humans of the long term occupational exposure, neuropsychological symptoms, disability in the psychological work tests, and the liver dysfunctions accompanied by fatty infiltrations in the liver were observed (industrial hygiene society reccomendation(1994), CERI Hazard Data(1999)), it was classified into Category 1 (central nervous systems, liver).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48-hour EC50=4290microg/L of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (MOE Risk Assessment No.3, 2004).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 2, since acute toxicity was Category 2 and not rapidly degrading (BOD: 2% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), though less bio-accumulative (BCF=86 (existing chemical safety inspections data)).
